page.title: 19LIFE STYLES IN SWINFORD
page.content: Children in the school interviewed other pupils on certain choices they made with regard to{life styles.} They found it difficult to organise the questionnaire but they decided to investigate:{ { {1.}which PETS they children liked{ {2.}where they bought their CLOTHES{ {3.}where they went on HOLIDAYS {4.}HOBBIES they had outside school. { 1.{PETS}- there were no unusual pets most chose cats, dogs or rabbits. 2.{CLOTHES}were purchased in Rugby. 3.{HOLIDAYS}in Cornwall were most popular. { 4.{HOBBIES}and other activities involving a wide range from tap dancing to stamp collecting.
